description:
Redevelopment of the site to form a mixed use development
with a British Transport Police Station and headquarters
Building on basement, ground and first to third floors (both
sui generis use), with pedestrian and vehicular entrances on
Whitfield Street, together with Class A1 retail use on the
basement, ground and first floors of the Tottenham Court
Road frontage, with plant on the first and fourth floors,
as shown by drawing numbers (a) 9445/1-4 and L277/P(0)/100A,
101, 102B, 103A, 104A, 105A, 106A, 108A, 109A, 110A, 111A,
112 and all documents and letters listed in the Schedule of
documentation dated 24 February 2000.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The retail Class A1 use hereby permitted shall not be
    carried out outside the following times:- 8.00am to 10.00pm
    Mondays to Saturdays.  The use on Sundays shall be for up to
    six hours only, commencing between 10.00am and Midday.

Condition : 2 - The details of the design of the elevations, the facing
    maintained as in the approved scheme.
    materials and the roof plant enclosure shall not be
    otherwise than shall have been submitted to and approved by
    the Council before the relevant part of the work on the site
    is commenced.  This submission should also include full
    details of the design and fitting of the vehicle doors on
    Whitfield Street, the retail goods entrance doors on Kirkman
    Place and the design and position of CCTV cameras and infra
    red lights.  The details approved should thereafter be

Condition : 3 - The return elevation of the shopfront window onto Kirkman
    Place shall be kept free of visual obstruction or shall
    otherwise be glazed and provided with a shopfront display in
    accordance with details to be approved with the local
    planning authority. Such an approved scheme to be
    implemented and retained in position.

Condition : 4 - The shutters or gates to the basement car park and the
    ground floor vehicle park on Whitfield Street shall operate
    at 4dB below the average night time (11pm to 7am) background
    noise levels. The maximum sound pressure level (which is
    likely to occur when the doors impact the floor) should not
    exceed 45dB(A) within any nearby residential premises.

Condition : 5 - No sound emanating from within the building shall be
    audible within any nearby residential premises between 23.00
    pm and 07.00 am.

Condition : 6 - Prior to the installation of any noise generating plant and
    equipment on site, including that on the first and fourth
    floors and the retail goods lift, detailed plans and
    specifications shall be submitted to and approved by the
    Council.

Condition : 7 - At 1 metre outside the windows of any neighbouring habitable
    room the level of noise from all plant, machinery and
    equipment shall be at all times at least 5 decibels below
    the existing background noise levels, expressed in dB(A) at
    such locations. Where the noise from the plant and machinery
    is tonal in character the differences in these levels shall
    be at least 10 dB(A).

Condition : 8 - Before the use commences, details of the method of storage
    and waste removal from the different uses of the building
    shall be submitted to and approved by the Council and the
    approved method shall thereafter be maintained.

Condition : 9 - No loading or unloading of goods, including fuel, by
    vehicles arriving at or departing from the Whitfield Street
    entrances to the premises shall be carried out otherwise
    than from within the curtilage of the building and shall not
    be carried out in such a way as to block access to the
    basement car park. The servicing of the site from Whitfield
    Street shall take place only between the hours of 08.00 and
    20.00.

Condition : 10 - The basement vehicle park hereby approved is for the parking
    of operational vehicles only. A scheme shall be submitted to
    the Council, be approved and implemented prior to the
    occupation of the premises, to demonstrate that four of the
    vehicle bays are capable of being used by people with
    disabilities (minimum of 3.3m x 4.8m).

Condition : 11 - No construction shall take place until a detailed design and method statement for all foundations and other development proposed below ground level which takes account of the proposed running tunnels of the Cross Rail Project including any ground movements arising from the construction of the Cross Rail tunnels, has been submitted to and approved by the Council.

Reason: So that the Council [and the Cross Rail Project Team] may be satisfied that the proposed Crossrail Project is adequately safeguarded, in accordance with the requirements of policy TR5 and as set out in T2 of the Schedule of Transport Proposals,  of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 12 - The street tree on the highway adjoining the site on
    Whitfield Street shall be retained and protected from damage
    to the satisfaction of the Council for a period of at least
    12 months following the completion of the development hereby
    approved, or such longer period as may be required under
    Sections 198 and 211 of the Town and Country Planning Act
    1990.

Condition : 13 - Details of the design of building foundations and the
    layout, with dimensions and levels, of service trenches and
    other excavations on site in so far as these items may
    affect the tree adjoining the site, shall be submitted to
    and approved by the Council as the local planning authority
    before any works on site are commenced.

Condition : 14 - To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the adjoining
    premises and the area generally.

Condition : 15 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building.

Condition : 16 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied with the
    external appearance of the building.

Condition : 17 - To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the adjoining
    premises and the area generally.

Condition : 18 - To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the adjoining
    premises and the area generally.

Condition : 19 - To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the adjoining
    premises and the area generally.

Condition : 20 - To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the adjoining
    premises and the area generally.

Condition : 21 - To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the adjoining
    premises and the area generally.

Condition : 22 - To avoid obstruction of the surrounding streets and to
    safeguard amenities of occupiers of the nearby premises.

Condition : 23 - To discourage unnecessary vehicular movements in accordance
    with policies TR2 and TR11.

Condition : 24 - So that the Council and the Chelsea Hackney Line Project
    Team may be satisfied that the proposed Chelsea Hackney Line
    Project is adequately safeguarded.

Condition : 25 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied that the
    development will not have an adverse effect on the existing
    trees and in order to maintain the character and amenities
    of the area.

Condition : 26 - To ensure that the Council may be satisfied that the
    development will not have an adverse effect on the existing
    trees and in order to maintain the character and amenities
    of the area.

Condition : 27 - The details required pursuant to the above conditions should
    be submitted with completed copies of the attached approval
    of details application form, together with 5 sets of
    drawings and any other supporting information.  More than
    one application may be made.

Condition : 28 - The development hereby approved may be subject to the
    Executive Infoline (tel.0514 545500)
    Construction (Design and Management) Regulations 1994 which
    govern health and safety through all stages of a
    construction project. The Regulations require clients  (ie.
    those, including developers, who commission construction
    projects) to appoint a planning supervisor and principal
    contractor who are competent and adequately resourced to
    carry out their health and safety responsibilities. Further
    information is available from the Health and Safety

Condition : 29 - The Council's Streets Management Engineering Services should
    be consulted regarding the construction of the crossover on
    the public highway and any other work to, under, or over,
    the public highway, including vaults and thresholds. The
    Section dealing with these matters is located at Camden Town
    Hall, Argyle Street London WC1H 8EQ, (tel: 020-7278 4444).

Condition : 30 - Your attention is drawn to the need to consult the Council's
    Environment & Consumer Protection Services, Waste Management
    Team, Camden Town Hall, Argyle Street entrance, Euston Road,
    London, WC1H 8EQ, (tel:020 7278 4444) regarding arrangements
    for the disposal of refuse.

Condition : 31 - Works of construction and ancillary activity should not take
    place other than between the hours of 08.00am to 18.00 pm on
    Monday to Friday and 08.00am to 13.00pm on Saturday, with no
    working on Sunday or Bank Holidays, in order to comply with
    locally enforced standards.

Condition : 32 - Noise from demolition and construction works is subject to
    control under the Control of Pollution Act 1974. You are
    advised to consult the Council's Environmental Commercial
    Service (Pollution Team), Camden Town Hall, Argyle Street,
    WC1H 8EQ, (tel: 020 7278 4444), or to seek prior approval
    under Section 61 if you anticipate any difficulty in
    carrying out construction other than within normal
    working hours and by means that would minimise disturbance
    to adjoining premises.

Condition : 33 - If a revision to the postal address becomes necessary as a
    result of this development, application under Part 2 of the
    London Building Acts (amendment) Act 1939 should be made to
    Records and Information Team, (Street Naming and Numbering)
    Environment Department, Camden Town Hall, Argyle Street,
    London WC1H 8EQ (tel 020 7974 5613)

Condition : 34 - Your attention is drawn to the fact that there is a separate
    legal agreement with the Council which relates to the
    development for which this permission is granted.

Condition : 35 - The correct street number or number and name must be
    displayed permanently on the premises in accordance with
    regulations made under Section 12 of the London Building
    (Amendments) Act 1939.

Condition : 36 - All works of demolition and construction shall take place in
    strict compliance with the Council's Considerate Contractor
    Manual.

Condition : 37 - The servicing of the retail premises shall not at any time
    Place service entrance;
    
    Sundays between the hours of 10.00am and 4.00pm from the
    Kirkman Place service entrance and the main entrance on
    Tottenham Court Road;
    and at no other times.
    take place save as follows:
    Mondays to Fridays between the hours of 7.00am and 10.00am
    from the Kirkman Place service entrance and the main
    entrance on Tottenham Court Road;
    
    Saturdays between the hours of 7.00am and 8.00am through the
    main entrance on Tottenham Court Road only and between the
    hours of 8.00am to 10.00am in addition from the Kirkman

Condition : 38 - To avoid obstruction of the surrounding streets and to
    safeguard amenities of the occupiers of the nearby premises.
